subject: [junit] BeforeClass Listener
msgSnippet: Hi, How can I know when a beforeclass is starting? Today with the listener I can know when test start but I need to also know when @BeforeClass method and
messageBody:
Hi,

How can I know when a beforeclass is starting?

Today with the listener I can know when test start but I need to also know
when @BeforeClass method and @AfterClass method starts.

It is very important to our project.

Thanks

--
